website_summaries.verdict: A good starter set to see if your child enjoys playing with these. If they do, though, you will want more than this.
pros: 60-piece set includes 4 large squares, 24 small squares, 18 small triangles, 8 medium triangles and 6 large triangles
cons: Tiles can come apart, spilling magnets on the floor, so keep away from babies and young toddlers

customer_reviews.title: She has severe dementia and this has become a great tool to engage her
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my mother and she really loves them. She has severe dementia and this has become a great tool to engage her. She is always coming up with another arrangement. The colors are beautiful and the magnets work well enough to hold most structures together. Everybody that spends time with her enjoys working with them as well.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Redman

customer_reviews.title: Tiles come apart exposing tiny magnets
customer_reviews.text: We have magna tiles and decided to buy these to build on our set. They seemed great, all the exact same sizing and compatible with the magna tiles but within 2 days several of the tiles came apart, the little magnets fall out posing a major choke hazard beyond not being able to use the tiles anymore. Super bummed out
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love, but not safe.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love these. They were a Santa present for my son, and a lot like the Magna tiles at our library. However, we have experienced a problem with the tiles popping apart and the small magnets falling out. This has happened twice now. After the first time, I contacted the company, who graciously sent me a replacement tile. Since this has now happened for the second time with a different tile, I will need to return these, as they are a safety concern.
customer_reviews.author: Misty Miley

customer_reviews.title: Compatible with Magna-Tiles
customer_reviews.text: These are exactly like Magna-Tiles. The only difference being Picasso Tiles are missing the metal rivets. I paid twice as much for the smaller set with half as many tiles for the other brand. I will definitely buy more and recommend Picasso Tiles. My 4 year old and 10 year old have a great time using these together. The 37pc and the new 60pc combined allow for so many new structures.
customer_reviews.author: Elle M

customer_reviews.title: the best toy
customer_reviews.text: This is seriously the best toy I've ever purchased. Someone literally plays w these every day in my home. We've had a set for a couple of years and they still get played w by at least one of my 5 kids daily. We bought more because they enjoy them so much. My kids are age 2 to 12 and each child can play w it on their own or they play together and make up pretend worlds, spaceships, kingdoms, boats, etc w them. Good fun sans electronics!!!
customer_reviews.author: RubySparkles

customer_reviews.title: Little builders will love these
customer_reviews.text: These keep a 5 year old builder happy. The shapes, magnets, and simplicity of design encourage imagination and free play. While they won’t replace legos, they seem to stimulate a whole different type of creativity...instead of trying to duplicate intricate designs in solitary play, we see a lot more story-telling, collaboration, and “big idea” play...castles, spaceships, towers, pyramids...and incorporating other toys and objects. These were a favorite toy at Head Start, and we were happy to find a large set at a good price to have at home. In addition to free play, we get to work on sorting, shapes, and colors, and also talk about magnetism, polarity, and simple physics and geometry.
customer_reviews.author: atty64

customer_reviews.title: Good product, bad shipping package
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to further my son's smaller set. It was going to be a surprise present. The package was delivered when on our way home. It shipped in the actual tile box, so it ruined the surprise because he could see it. I am not used to anything arriving in the original box via amazpn, its usually an amazon box or brown box/envelope. I was very dissatisfied with how it wasn't in a box to disguise them. Beyond that, anyone could see what it was amd take it off our doorstep before we came home. It is a big, noticeable box. The set we had before has held up well and my son really loves them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed with the shipping
customer_reviews.text: I have used these blocks at schools I have worked at. They are wonderful and provide hours of fun for young children. I ordered these as a gift for my niece and nephew. These came just like this (see picture) with shipping stickers all over the box. The box is supposed to be reused and it appears to be ruined with three different stickers for shipping. I am all for saving boxes, but not ruining the box the actual product came in and is stored in. I am hopeful that these will still be a hit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Picasso Tiles
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered these before and had no issue--certainly worth the money and quality is just as good as the more expensive Magnatile brand. My issue is that they came in a nice box--but damaged box as well as inside the box the plastic covering was open and all scratched up as well as shipping labels plastered all over the Picasso tile box. I am sure the magnets would have worked just fine but I could not give them as a gift with the box looking like it did and that was my intention.
customer_reviews.author: Karen A. Rackliff

customer_reviews.title: Great product to fuel my children's imagination
customer_reviews.text: Great product to fuel my children's imagination. They were instantly building big towers and various structures. The magnets are strong and have no problems connecting. There are plenty of pieces in this set to build. My only negative is that the four large (four square pieces) do not have magnets at the center and therefore can only connect on the outsides. Definitely not a reason not to big. Overall, it's a great set for the price!!
customer_reviews.author: Denise L.

customer_reviews.title: Great toy - Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: My children love Picasso tiles and this was given as a gift for another 4 year old. Great for imagination/creativity. I received a message from the other child's mother stating that these have become her daughter's new favorite toy! The colors are fantastic and the magnets clip together easily with good hold. My 2 and 4 year old build with them effortlessly and love making various buildings while using their imaginations. The Picasso tiles hold their attention for a decent amount of time and are also easy to clean up, as they clip together and fit nicely in their box, which is a HUGE plus!
customer_reviews.author: Al G

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my growing mag tile set
customer_reviews.text: My first time purchasing Picasso tiles. Very pleased. So here are the pros & cons when comparing to other brands: Pros-larger color selection including teal & pink. The plastic is more clear and looks more like stained glass. It also has less decor/ design to distract the eye. It includes more large squares to build on- 6 I believe. Other brands contain 2. You can build larger projects with these. Cons- the magnets are not as strong as some other brands. I would repurchase more of these. Although I rather like mixing the different brands for variety.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Beats magna tiles.
customer_reviews.text: We have bought 3 sets of these for our kids and their cousins. Everyone loves them. My youngest started really enjoying and playing with these at about 18 months. He loved to build boxes and store cars in them. My 4 year old builds all sorts of things and their 10 year old cousin uses them to build houses for Playmobil figures. Super useful, and non gender specific. We love them.
customer_reviews.author: CJF

customer_reviews.title: good deal
customer_reviews.text: Kids love these things, to stop the fighting we bought 2 of these used ones. They came in the original box and seem to be in great shape. Good deal if your kids don't need to have the extra plastic around the box.
customer_reviews.author: Shlomo

customer_reviews.title: A Must for Busy Fingers and Curious Minds.
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing! We have 5 grandchildren and all of them love these tiles! We have given them as gifts for Christmas and keep a set in our house for when they visit. The kids call them "Sticky Shapes". It is always the first toy they go for when they come into the house. The Picasso tiles may be a little more expensive than some but they stick well, the magnets seem well protected and the corners are not super sharp. So many things can be done with them. I've been amazed at the creative projects that have been built in our house alone! Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bookworm

customer_reviews.title: Fun to be had for the whole family!
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this! As in we are getting a couple of more because there are constant fights over them. They are easy to loose though, so make sure you keep track of them. With a 2 and a 4 year olds we keep finding them in the most random places. My husband and I (pushing 40, lol) are enjoying them too. We are buying the accessories next (ramps, carts, etc.). Fun to be had for the whole family!
customer_reviews.author: Mom & Dad

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good with a couple suggestions.
customer_reviews.text: Great idea but could use a little tweaking. The very large squares have no magnets in the middle so you can only put things on the edges. No idea why. The tall triangles are awkward too, the only thing you seem to be able to make with those are the tall spires like in the photo. I could imagine some more useful shapes to replace those. Besides those issues though, my toddler likes it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Trachtman

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Children absolutely love using these. Not only can you build and stack and color match...but you can hold them up to sunlight and have the color shine through to the wall or floor. They have fun placing small characters inside boxes they have made, towers, mixing tile colors, and looking out the window...Bring a piece up to there Eye,,,viewing,,,as colorful spyglass of color.A really super present highly recommend for 2 1/2 to 8-year-olds, however the adults always have fun playing with these as well
customer_reviews.author: Koren Harrison

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter loved, loved these. We built with them for hours throughout the day. She kept going back to them to play with them. We made houses and garages and brick roads for her paw patrol puppies. They are a lot of fun. Would definitely buy some more!
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Mulligan

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I hesitated buying these building blocks for a few years, since my children (a five year old girl a three year old girl and an 18 month old boy) haven't been super into building yet. But they all love it so much! I can't wait to buy more blocks. It is a favorite for anyone that visits our house and they all fight over the pieces. It's something I can even even handle playing with them. If you are on the fence about this just get it, they will love it. Also it's a timeless toy that will grow with them as they age.
customer_reviews.author: MES

customer_reviews.title: My 2 year old loves them....and so do I!
customer_reviews.text: These come I’m an amazing box you can definitely store these in. However, we choose to just keep them in a basket because we use them so often! My two year old loves making “houses”! I love building with them too! These are really MY fave toy to play with lol. It took her about two weeks to master using them, and now she can build tall towers and complex pyramids with no help! Best thing is that while my two year old loves them, when older kids visit they love to play with them too!
customer_reviews.author: Jajat

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price. Tiles are durable and strong
customer_reviews.text: My kids love building with these tiles. They are a great value for the price. The name brand tiles give you a few tiles, but charge top dollar. My children are 3 and 5, and they equally love to play with the tiles and make new creations. I have always enjoyed this product, and it is a nice addition to their already big collection of Picasso Magnst tiles. The tiles are very durable. There is no limit to the things that you can build with these tiles. I plan on purchasing again and expanding their collection.
customer_reviews.author: Soph

customer_reviews.title: Strong magnets, quality plastic
customer_reviews.text: These are great magnetic tiles. I did a lot of research on magnetic tiles and decided to give these a shot. Very happy that I did! My kids love them. The magnets are strong and the plastic is quality. This is a great starter set with a variety of sizes and shapes. I’ve already purchased more sets to go along with this one. The box that this set comes in has quite a bit of extra space, so you can fit more tiles in it. Box is heavy duty with a handle, so kids can grab it and play wherever they want to. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Endless Entertainment
customer_reviews.text: My kids (2.5yo boy & 4.5yo girl) got this for Christmas & it has provided HOURS of entertainment every day! It’s the first thing they go for when they wake up in the morning. In the two weeks that they’ve had it I’ve noticed their creativity in building has really blossomed. They are building things from their imagination, sorting by shapes and color, & really thinking about construction. My son is VERY rough with his toys, but I haven’t noticed any deconstruction or damage in the blocks yet. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: freckles317

customer_reviews.title: I bought this toy for my Kinder classroom and 6 months after it is as good as new!
customer_reviews.text: I am a Kindergarten teacher and was looking for toys for my students. I wanted something that was durable, safe, entertaining for kids and easy to clean up after. This was one of the best products I have bought for my class! It has been around 6 months now and my students still play with it! The pieces are very durable and students enjoy cleaning up after it and putting it back in the box (all pieces fit like a puzzle). I would recommend it and now I am looking for something comparable to this product. It was a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: andrea

customer_reviews.title: These are Soooooo fun!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We have actually purchased 4 sets of these magnet sets so we do have alot however WE LOVE THESE SO MUCH we will be getting more when we can. My 3 year old built "the castle" as he calls it that is in the picture, quite amazing actually. When his 5 year old sister helps it entertains them for hours. Sometimes I sneak and play with them myself, Haha no seriously I do its fun. This is the best investment as far as toys go, it helps them build many different skills and thinking pattern's. I will be telling all the relatives to get these for my kids when they ask what do they need for birthdays, etc..
customer_reviews.author: Happy guy

customer_reviews.title: For ANY age, these are my favorite gift ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have four kids ages ranging from 3-9. All four kids play with these tiles constantly. We have cousins that come over who are “too cool” to play with their younger cousins and I catch them building with these every time they come over too! I’ll be honest, I catch myself building with these when they are out on the table too. And the sky’s the limit on what you can make with them. We are on our third box of these tiles to add to our collection. They’re super durable and the more you have, the more you can build.
customer_reviews.author: HandleyMom

customer_reviews.title: They sliced my finger right out of box. Check edges!
customer_reviews.text: My 2.5 year old son started having fun with these right away. His cousin has some so we knew it was a good toy. I would recommend inspecting all the pieces thoroughly before giving them to children to play with. I sliced my finger on a sharp plastic edge on a triangle. Felt all of the shapes, and pulled out 8 more triangles and one square for having sharp plastic flack. So I need to somehow melt or smooth these down. Just be careful that you’re not only making sure there’s no cracks and the magnets are secure, but also look for very sharp edges.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Full Family Fun
customer_reviews.text: The new family favorite!! My daughter just turned three and I wanted to gice her a toy that was enjoyable and somewhat educational so this seemed to fit the brief appropriately. I didn't imagine that our whole family would be coming up with new creations amd variations. This is a great toy and it offered a great discount when we purchased it. We're considering ordering another set because of how much we love them!
customer_reviews.author: FerristOfThemAll

customer_reviews.title: My grandkids love these
customer_reviews.text: I bought a set for my 3yr old granddaughter's birthday and they want to play with them every day. Someone else bought the same set for her and her mom sent it back, now she says she wish she had kept it because with these tiles the more you have the more fun you can have. Great fun and it is fun seeing little brains and fingers working out how to assemble them into various things. Love them
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Stairway to imagination
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in good condition with all the pieces accounted for. Got for my 3 year old for her birthday. She loves these. She'll play with them for hours if I let her. She was quick to figure them out with her 7 year old sister and they'll build towers and garages for their cars and whatever they can think of. If your child likes to organize by color and stack things perfectly these are a must have as well.
customer_reviews.author: CJ Dreadful

customer_reviews.title: Ok.
customer_reviews.text: Doesnt hold.. can be used for older kids who are aware of how to be carefully assemble things but the 3year old grew frustrated that their creation would fall apart once they started to play with it. I got this as a gift because the reviews said it was comparable to magnatiles.. It's not. It's not as sturdy. So creation will fall onto its self.
customer_reviews.author: Kimmie

customer_reviews.title: everybody plays with them
customer_reviews.text: no reflection on the seller at all, these tiles speak for themselves. well worth the purchase price. bought months and months ago and they are still played with everyday. We are a busy family and toys dont always get picked up right away, so these get stepped on in the play room, pretty often. NEVER had an issue with a break or a crack...they are durable and colorful and fun fun fun. Always a pretty pricey product no matter where you purchase them. I got them here on sale. We buy little light to put inside what we make and it looks great with the colors etc. love
customer_reviews.author: Christine C

customer_reviews.title: A Great Tool for a Child's Imagination
customer_reviews.text: These tiles are amazing. My 2.5 year old loves them. We have this and the 100 piece set so he can build large castles and houses for his animals. The price per piece is so much more bearable than the Magna Tiles and the quality in my opinion is just as good. They have been tossed around, stepped on, dropped, hit, and none have broken or even cracked. Perfect for a child's imagination they allow them to build whatever they can think of. Even great for the parents and my wife and myself have found ourselves building with them and creating.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Such a great toy for kids
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my son last Christmas and even my two year olds love playing with them. They are easy to clean up and not painful to step on (legos and Dinosaur toys I’m looking at you!!!) my kids play with these all the time and the price is so good compared to other brands. My kids continue to go back to play with these and it’s fun for adults to join the fun as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jumping Beans

customer_reviews.title: Love them, very entertaining and stick to the fridge
customer_reviews.text: Went to discovery center and seen these my kiddos really wanted them . I was leery because they are 4 and 3. I thought they might get frustrated trying to figure them out or break them crashing their towers. However they have helped up to lots of crashing and my kids love to build with them. They will sit for hours building zoos and castles and farms. Bonus they stick to the fridge too.
customer_reviews.author: S. Porter

customer_reviews.title: they cost less and worked better. We will probably stick to that brand
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 6 yo son for Christmas. Some of the magnets are polarized and wont stick to other pieces. the magnet strength isn't very strong so things tend to fall apart which causes massive frustration when he's been working on a project for a bit. We had a similar product from another manufacturer , they cost less and worked better. We will probably stick to that brand. disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Niko meszaros

customer_reviews.title: Basic fun
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love these tiles and now have 2 sets. The only thing I would consider a negative, (and it’s not really a negative) is the set doesn’t come with any moving pieces like hinges or wheels. You can buy car pieces or a ferris wheel separately but it would be fun if at least one came with the larger sets. Otherwise, we have a lot of fun building with these. They keep my 4 year old interested and have for over a year now.
customer_reviews.author: Kara P.

customer_reviews.title: Bright colorful Learning curve
customer_reviews.text: 2 year old lost interest next to his new toy truck and cycle. However, this will be a great indoor rainy day event. Recommend the adult and older sibling to encourage activity until toddlers interest connecting. This something that will last and be useful ages 3-10. Although adults liked fidgeting with them as well.
customer_reviews.author: smilingdog

customer_reviews.title: Nice beginner tiles...
customer_reviews.text: Nice beginner tiles for 4 years old. She enjoys playing with it. The tiles hold each other pretty good. The plastic in tiles seems to be flimsy. As our home has carpet, not seeing any damage to the tiles when they fall or being tossed by the kid. But it may break on wooden floor. There are no activity sheets come along with the package. Instead it is being sent in an email by the seller. Still it is a pending task in my "To-Do" list to take color printouts of them.
customer_reviews.author: Tamilan_da

customer_reviews.title: Awesome buy
customer_reviews.text: We have two boys (4 &2) who love these blocks. We were given a set of the more expensive brand for Christmas but we wanted to get some more. My wife found these as part of a lightning deal. We think these are better quality than the more expensive ones. Our boys are not able to tell the difference. My wife took one and through it on the floor and against the wall several times as she knows how rough our boys can be. You could not tell a difference. The durability of these magnets has been great so far.
customer_reviews.author: dfitz

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as magna tile ,for fraction of the cost.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely something I would feel confident giving as a gift for a kid.Pretty comparable to magna tiles without paying near as much.Only difference I noticed between picasso and magna tiles is, magna is probably built bit more stronger with internal support throughout.I accidentally stepped on a picasso tile and while it did not break,felt like it might if I'd had boots on.Less support in the middle of tile if that makes sense. I will definitely buy again as my go to gift for kid birthdays. I have already recommended and received a thank you .
customer_reviews.author: David McAlhaney

customer_reviews.title: Strong and durable. Great magnetic stick
customer_reviews.text: I’m a STEM teacher and I see over a 1,000 kids within 9 weeks. These blocks have been stepped on, smashed, fallen from tall tower construction, and thrown into bids for over 4 years now and none have broken! They still work as strong as ever! They are worth every penny. My 6 year old got a cheaper brand of these blocks for a gift and those showed me just how amazing picasso tiles are. The cheaper brand does not compare. ALL THE KIDS, Kindergarten thru 5th graders LOVE THEM!! It’s the most popular building block set in my STEM room. Wish I could get more.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Sergeant-Tum

customer_reviews.title: Good tiles, but keep them off tile floors
customer_reviews.text: These are great tiles, and our two boys have played for hours with them. The magnets are strong, but yes they will not hold for ever. I can dangle 4-5 of these magnets from one square, so there is a bit of strength to them. One bit of caution, if you have a tile kitchen floor watch out as these become very slippery. My lovely wife took a "trip of a lifetime" and almost ended up in the hospital tonight.
customer_reviews.author: Rebeca

customer_reviews.title: Kids love them
customer_reviews.text: It didnt take long to realize a 60 piece set wasn't quite enough after receiving as a gift. Purchased to expand and also got the set of 2 train cars. These are loved by our 4 and 6 year old, I even find myself building with them on occasion when no one is looking. They hurt way less to step on than a lego, and I haven't broken one yet when this happens so it speaks to their durability.
customer_reviews.author: putzy23

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely FRUSTRATING. I bought for my son who is 31/2 and only says a few words, he loves focusing and building but these stinkin things drive me crazy just as much! The magnets hardly stick together, my son ends up screaming and getting so upset I feel terrible and I know EXACTLY how he feels. I’ll be returning these. I’m surprised by all the really good positive reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Brittnie Guise

customer_reviews.title: Poor delivery system
customer_reviews.text: This product came to my house like this. Not in a box. Way to ruin my son’s Christmas present. Thanks a bunch.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy E. Collins

customer_reviews.title: The best toy ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best thing I’ve gotten my kids. They love it. They are little creators and build these imaginable creations. I have bought 3 sets one as a gift and one for each of my kids. They can’t get enough of it. I guess 4 sets.. one went to their nana’s house. They are obsessed! Who knew magnets would bring this much happiness and creativity to them! My kids are 2.4&4.5 boy and girl. Great gift for younger kids.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best gift that lasts for years
customer_reviews.text: These tiles are AMAZING and comparable to magnatiles (name brand) but less expensive. My kids (ages 3 and 5) love them so much we ordered another set so we could build more. I also use them at my job (I am a psychologist in an elementary building) and all the elementary kids LOVE them too up through fifth grade. So this really is a toy that will last across many years. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: SMR

customer_reviews.title: So much fun! Our kids love them.
customer_reviews.text: These magnet blocks are AWESOME! Our three year old plays with them every day. She loves them. There’s so many ways to build with them that she never gets bored. This is our second set. We bought these to double our collection. Even our 8 and 10 year olds play with them. Great product. Durable. We haven’t had any break yet. Cannot recommend this toy enough!
customer_reviews.author: heather

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth it!
customer_reviews.text: My five year old LOVES these! Once school was cancelled due to Covid-19, I quickly began to assess toys/what I could use to continue his education and allow creativity. He has always liked to build, so I decided to take a chance on these based on previous reviews and the description to reiterate shapes, colors and of course, using the imagination. Our Son has used these multiple times per week since purchase and the magnets within each piece are very durable and so are the shapes themselves. He does try to take care of them, so they go back in the box when done. Definitely recommend and will probably purchase more so he can make his creations even bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Grandson #2 loves them
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd time I have purchased these building tiles for my grandson. The first set I purchased was for my 1st grandson 3 years ago and he was crazy about them. Now a 2nd grandson is crazy about them. They survived unscathed for a while and then grandson number 2 got hold of them and they gradually disappeared. Now he has a whole new set of his own. He loves to build with them but he also loves to carry them around with him (1st one didn't do that) so I am hoping he manages to hang on to them longer than the last set.
customer_reviews.author: DragonQueen65

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly compete to Megna tiles
customer_reviews.text: A second thought on buying these: Do not but if you see quality as priority. Compare to M tiles, these have less megnetic, plates are thinner but heavier, and less stable after being constructed. After buying three sets of piccaso tiles, I thought, why don’t try M tiles? And I did. You know what? After trying out their tiles, I am now regret buying other brands. So, to people who are considering: think what you really value and decide whether to buy piccaso or M.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My 2 Year old Loves it
customer_reviews.text: My Mom gave her this as her BDay present and my 2 Year old loves playing around with it. The quality of this toy is very good. She likes to "see through the vibrant colors" and stacking them up is really cool. Make sure you safe the Box when you want to put them away for next day activities.
customer_reviews.author: W I 28

customer_reviews.title: Great gift.  Lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the for my daughter. She really enjoyed playing them at the library so I wanted her to have a set of her on. It was shipped in the actual box so if it’s a gift be sure to check it’s a gift when checking out so they put it inside a generic box. She really likes them. It’s a great gift. Great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Steven S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice learning tool...toy;-)
customer_reviews.text: Our twin 3 year old granddaughters were excited to get these and went right to building. One of them spent over an hour the first night building stalls and dog houses for her little figurines. She has played with it every day since we got them. The other twin plays but isn't as enthralled.
customer_reviews.author: Johnie

customer_reviews.title: Great for teaching Geometry for 3-D
customer_reviews.text: Great for teaching 3-D prisms by building layers with the same shape. Much better alternative to the plain plastic manipulatives advertised by instructional resource vendors/manufacturers. The "storage container" listed is nothing more than the box it came in. I have my co-workers wanting the same, but we need more options!!! It would be more complete if I were able to purchase additional shapes, such as rectangles, circles, pentagons, hexagons, etc for mathematical instruction.I could also find great value in a "linear" set of Picasso for teaching perimeter versus area.
customer_reviews.author: AMathWhiz

customer_reviews.title: They do the job, for less cost than the name brand
customer_reviews.text: I got these on sale for $30, which in my opinion makes them worth the price. I can definitely tell a quality difference when compared to the name brand. I do like that they are bigger pieces than the name brand, however the small magnets inside rattle around so I worry about the quality long term.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Gillespie

customer_reviews.title: Great for all ages
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing! I have a 4 year old and 2 year old and they both adore these. The 4 year makes giant castles, towers and buildings while my 2 year old gets a kick out of just making any small box out of magnets. Even my husband and I have fun help making crazy towers and showing our girls how magnets work. It’s fun to build with something other than Legos every now and then!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for girls too!
customer_reviews.text: I often struggle finding toys that I can enjoy playing along side my little girl. These tiles are awesome! They stick together really well and don't have the magnets that can come out like other tiles do. We can play and build things for hours. I would recommend getting more than one set, you will want to go bigger and better after every build!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Not very strong magnet
customer_reviews.text: I feel bad giving them 2 stars but I got these as a second set because my daughter loved her playmags these are way worse in comparison and similar price. They are functional but the magnets barely stick together, not the greatest, if your deciding between these and playmags go with playmags!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for toddler, easy to play and build
customer_reviews.text: Got these as a gift for my 2 year old and had to buy another set because he loved them so much! So now we have two 60 piece sets and the train pack. He can’t get enough and really encourages the imagination. It’s also easy to use for toddlers. He was having an OK time with mega blocks, but has been loving these way more.
customer_reviews.author: Cherlyn

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my granddaughters, ages 2 & 5, and they have been a huge hit! They have an 8 year old cousin, who is used to electronic entertainment and easily becomes bored with traditional toys, that loves them, too. They are appropriate for a wide range of ages. They encourage creativity and imaginative play as well as helping develop fine motor skills.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen J. Mabrey

customer_reviews.title: Picasso Tiles are a wonderful developmental toy.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for an almost 3 year old granddaughter. She is loving them. She is really enjoying organizing them by color and shape. Hopefully she will also start enjoying the building aspect of them as well. I was worried about magnets being part of the pieces due to other younger children around but the pieces are a good size and the magnets are completely contained inside each piece. The pieces are sturdy and well made. I think this item will be a great toy for her to enjoy for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: T R

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: We already had some picasso tiles and bought more to complete our set. My kids can be hours and hours playing with it. Develop their creativity a lot and their hand skill. I highly recommend these magnetic tiles. They are also very sturdy even after lot's of throwing or falling down.
customer_reviews.author: yoyo

customer_reviews.title: Put the tablet down and play with magnets!
customer_reviews.text: From toddler-aged children, right up through adult ages, this “toy” feels more like a mind-expanding activity for understanding geometry, magnetic attraction and gravity. It comes with the perfect number of pieces to create any type of small or medium structure you wish to build and the colors add to the experience. My children adore them and, honestly, we always end up fighting over who gets the last piece with which to construct our little projects. I would recommend this product for any home and it’s safe to play with around babies because the pieces are too large to be choking hazards. Best purchase ever!
customer_reviews.author: Abraham

customer_reviews.title: We initially bought the 60 count when our 2 year old son's teacher told us he really liked the magnetic tiles they have at schoo
customer_reviews.text: We loooove these tiles! We initially bought the 60 count when our 2 year old son's teacher told us he really liked the magnetic tiles they have at school. Once he started playing with the tiles we discovered that he loved to build tall "houses" so we bought a second set. His cousins who are 6 and 8 loved them so much when they come to play that we also bought them a set for their birthday. Would definitely recommend tue product.
customer_reviews.author: cbear626

customer_reviews.title: Educational
customer_reviews.text: I saw these at my grandchildren's preschool and so purchased a kit to have for them to play with while at my home. My three year old grandson loves these and spends an hour at a time just creating structures. They are great for that age group, easy to use and great quality.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Everyone was pleased and I was too at first
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews carefully before I made this purchase. Everyone was pleased and I was too at first. But after just playing with the tiles a few times some of the pieces chipped and cracked! I just have one kid playing with it and she's a very gentle child. Just playing with it normally. I will definitely not be buying or recommending this company to anyone anymore.
customer_reviews.author: na

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again, without hesitation
customer_reviews.text: My son ALWAYS plays with the set my nephews have when we visit so I decided to break down and get him his own. His aunt got him the same set for Christmas so now he has 2 of the 60 pc sets and I LOVE how creative hes been getting with these sets! They are easy to pick up and the mess is easier to cope with since I KNOW how much he enjoys them!
customer_reviews.author: Sammie Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Good tiles
customer_reviews.text: Good value. Had these for years now and my kids (now 4 & 8) have played with them so much. Its pretty much the only toy that's been something the have consistantly went for through the years. They both build amazing things with these. Would recommend. Would be a great gift.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Kids love them!
customer_reviews.text: My kids love playing with these! The only thing that is a bummer is that the larger square pieces only have magnets around the perimeter, wish they had them going through the middle. 60 pieces is ok for one child to start with. I will need to buy more because my kids keep arguing when they play together.
customer_reviews.author: Jontue

customer_reviews.title: Innovative, instructive magnetic shapes for children - great for spacial learning and improving dexterity
customer_reviews.text: This is the second set of these magnetic tiles that we have purchased for our grandchildren. Our 4 yo grandson is able to built multiple levels and make the pyramids and other shapes. Even our 2 yo grandson likes to put them together. They seem indestructible. They are kind of a pain to keep putting back into the box they came in, so we found a small plastic chest to hold them and that is much easier to manage when its time to pick them up. A great toy that is well worth the expense.
customer_reviews.author: Fozwort

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product, colors not as shown
customer_reviews.text: I love these magnetic tiles, they're awesome! Only downside is the colors do not come as shown on the box, instead of a large green tile I received an orange one, as well, lots of small pink tiles, not a huge problem but I wasn't aware of this before buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing gift.
customer_reviews.text: I was picking up my nephew at daycare one day and he would not stop playing with these. I decided to get them for Christmas, and he immediately started playing with them on the floor and he didn't want to open any more presents. These are well worth the money and I loved seeing my six year old nephew so happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia.

customer_reviews.title: Best E-Learning Gift ever for my pre-k student!
customer_reviews.text: One of my student's moms emailed me asking for rainy day ideas during e-learning and I found the duplicate manipulatives her son enjoys in class on Amazon. It was perfect! The mom sent a video of my student literally in heaven using the magna tiles. Perfect gift for at-home learning.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy in Illinois

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as other brands but still amazing
customer_reviews.text: These were available for a fantastic price as compared to the magnatiles so I bought 2 packs of these instead. I feel like magnatiles had stronger magnets and I like the rivets holding them together better, however, I have not had any issue with these falling apart or breaking. My 3 year old and husband don't take it easy on them. They've built tons of towers that reach the ceiling.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal M

customer_reviews.title: Shipping was terrible.
customer_reviews.text: These are lighter weight than the magna tiles. They seem to work fine though. My biggest gripe is that I purchased this item as a gift. It was shipped to me in the original box with no outer box so the shipping stickers were applied directly to the front of the package. I can’t remove the shipping labels without damaging the item. 😡😡
customer_reviews.author: L. Forster

customer_reviews.title: The kids go nuts for these!
customer_reviews.text: I have a hard time remembering a toy that was so popular by all ages of kids. My niece and nephew both love to play with these. They are such a cool idea I wish we would have had them we I was younger! I fully intend to buy a couple sets of these. Build bigger and better projects. They click together so easily and are so simple to make into structures. Keeps the kiddos entertained for hours! Very pleased with my purchase! 😃😃
customer_reviews.author: Alicia MTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: WE LOVE THESE!!
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely loooove these blocks! My son is just about 2 and these are so much fun. They are easy to use and you can build a lot of things! I bought these on amazon prime day for a great deal. I would not have paid full price of 100 dollars for them even tho they are fun! But 100 dollars is a bit much. I paid 30 something and if they go on sale again we will buy more!
customer_reviews.author: TW20

customer_reviews.title: Magnetic coolness!
customer_reviews.text: These tiles really rock! My little one saw them while on travel and Santa brought them to him for Christmas. He spends more time building stuff with these, imagination magnetic blocks and legos. 3 Solid items to build imagination and learning. Kids can build rockts, houses, blocks, all in 3D.. I would recommend getting at least the 60PCs right off the bat and add to it over time. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Michael A. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Great value and quality
customer_reviews.text: I was always worried about purchasing magnet tiles due to the expensive price and landed on this Picasso brand in case my child didn’t enjoy them. These work great and child plays with them nearly every day in the past month. Will purchase again/ more.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Oicasso Tiles
customer_reviews.text: I actually purchased this as a Christmas present for a great grandson. A different great grandson visited over the weekend and brought his Picasso Tiles with him. He and the other children were enjoying his tiles so very much I decided this would be the perfect Christmas present for the great grandson who did not have any.
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: Endless fun for all
customer_reviews.text: We love these tiles. After playing with them at a local children’s museum we discovered what a fun alternative they are to traditional blocks. They snap together so nice and easy. This was our second set! Our 3.5 year old loves building amazing towers with them but I’m not sure which one of us has more fun with them!
customer_reviews.author: Ipin-stuff

customer_reviews.title: Fits well with other brand of tiles. Strong magnets.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an addition to another set of of tiles of a different brand. They fit well with the other tiles. Excluding the roof, one picture shows the Picasso tiles on the side of the structure built by my 4 year old grandson. In the other, the Picasso tiles are between the drawn yellow lines. Highly recommend. I may buy another set.
customer_reviews.author: Buzzmaam

customer_reviews.title: My son LOVED these when he played with them at preschool
customer_reviews.text: My son LOVED these when he played with them at preschool. A friend gifted some for us to have at home and he used them for many years. Endless possibilities for a creative and imaginative mind and little hands! We have now purchased this for our granddaughter for a Christmas gift. Time will tell if she enjoys them as much as her uncle... The tiles are easy to grasp and attach to other tiles easily making building structures and shapes easy and stable while coming apart with ease when pulled. We can't wait to see what she makes with her tiles!
customer_reviews.author: Mary R Erwin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for little hands
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Durable Tried to break one to see how easy it breaks to ensure my toddler doesn't not swallow magnets and it did not come apart perfect for floor, table and two player play the box it comes with is made to be used as a storage box for product Cons: None
customer_reviews.author: Gigi from El Paso, Texas

customer_reviews.title: Best toy
customer_reviews.text: Amazing toy for older toddlers and kids. I play with my toddler and i actually enjoy it. The only thing i wish i did is order 2 or 3 sets instead of one because sometimes i get too excited and wanna create a masterpiece! My toddler on other hand is pretty content with one set. Plus one set is easier to clean when you are playing with a toddler who is 90% of the time won't clean up after playing. When my son is older i plan in order more.
customer_reviews.author: Asma

customer_reviews.title: Absolute delight for our 3 year old
customer_reviews.text: Our 3 year old daughter loves playing with her first set of magnetic tiles for over an year now. We decided to add more to her collection and no complains, we thought these 60 pc set maybe too much but have to agree, we could have gone to 100... Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Pro Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun for both kids
customer_reviews.text: I like the variety of colorful pieces and that the set had enough pieces for both kids to share. I like that this toy promotes a lot of creativity and both boys (ages 5 and 7) have been creating structures to house their dinosaurs, garages for their cars, etc. I'm hoping the set goes on sale again so I can double their collection.
customer_reviews.author: Tall Girl

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for STEM!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these hoping to encourage my curious girls to build. My 4 year old especially has a natural tendency to take apart and destroy, and these magnetic blocks definitely help keep her busy! My 5 year old took to them, too, and both spend hours playing with even a handful of blocks. I highly recommend them for children who are too young to try science experiments but who love figuring out how machines are made. (We've had these for over a year, and they are still a hit around here. They still stick and hold up well, too.)
customer_reviews.author: Jeniffer SmithTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Nice product for gifting purposes
customer_reviews.text: I first saw it when one of my colleague got it for his son. Loved it so much that I got it for my daughter. She also loved it and keeps her busy almost every day. I even bought one as a gift for my sister's daughter. I think it increases creativity in small kids as they can make whatever they want with it as it is very easy to assemble. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Change in quality
customer_reviews.text: This is my second time purchasing a set of 60 tiles and while they are great, this second set differs in quality. The first set of Picasso tiles seemed sturdier and had no blunt/harsh edges. They were seamless and smooth. This newer set seems like a slightly cheaper plastic and has rough edges where the tiles were snapped together to house the magnets. They still get full run play, but for this quality I have also purchased off brand tiles that have given the same harsh edges/cheaper plastic. I came back to Picasso because my first set was far superior.
customer_reviews.author: T A

customer_reviews.title: Favs
customer_reviews.text: My sister in law always gets these for her school so we assumed that this would be a good gift and boy were we right! The birthday boy loved them and he has so much fun with them and they are very easy to clean which is always a bonus when you are dealing with children. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: These are a great toy, they are durable and just as much for for adults of kids. This helps little ones with motor skills and older kids have fun using imagination with them. We first played with these at a children's museum and they were a lot of fun for the kids to build and then knock down and rebuild. Only downside is the cost but they are durable and still get played with for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Gon

customer_reviews.title: Such good quality and I love the low price!
customer_reviews.text: These tiles are amazing!! I have bought the more expensive ones previously so I was skeptical buying these but did after reading the reviews. I am so happy I did!! They are stronger than the actual Magnatile brand & my son loves building high towers with them. I’ll be buying more!
customer_reviews.author: Christine Deeke

customer_reviews.title: Granddaughter Loves These!
customer_reviews.text: We gave these PicassoTiles Magnet Building Tiles to our granddaughter for Christmas upon recommendation from her school and she absolutely loves these and plays with them all the time. They're very sturdy, easy to use and are very attractive. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Fayzie345

customer_reviews.title: Great for all ages
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I’ve bought these because my kids loved them so much they asked for more. They’re absolutely just as great as the more expensive brands. The best thing is that they appeal to kids of all ages so my 4 year old and 9 year old can actually enjoy the same activity together.
customer_reviews.author: Laura K.

customer_reviews.title: Be careful, some pieces brake easily.
customer_reviews.text: I Gifted this product to a friend and I was very disappointed when my friend told me that 2 of the pieces broke immediately on her kid hands. Thank god she was right in front of her child when this happened so she rushed to clean all the magnets before her kid put them in his mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My kids love them & actually play together
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to buy these for my kids for a long time. I saw the price & read reviews so I decided to get them. Well worth it. My son's 5 & my daughter's 9 yrs and its very rare that they pkay together quietly and without fighting right away. But they love these & they sit and play quietly everytime. I've had them for awhile now & thre 60pc is plenty to keep my 2 kids playing. I'll probably buy another set only because they'll be able to build more stuff.
customer_reviews.author: LaLa

product_meta.title: PicassoTiles 60 Piece Set 60pcs Magnet Building Tiles Clear Magnetic 3D Building Blocks Construction Playboards - Creativity Beyond Imagination, Inspirational, Recreational, Educational, Conventional
product_meta.description:
Creativity Beyond Imagination! Learning by Playing!
Inspirational:
Fun and entertaining, perfect educational presents for school age children that will never go out of style. 

Recreational:
Entertaining for single or multiple parties, great for parent-to-child bonding with hours of fun quality time. Easy to construct and easy to put away for storage. 

Educational: Learning is Fun!
It's never too early to start developing kids creativity at a young age, PicassoTiles inspire youngsters learning by playing, children will acquire a strong sense of colors, geometrical shapes including 3D forms, number counts, magnetic polarity, architectural design as well as creativity which is the key factor to success in today's ever-changing environment. Give the youngsters a head start. 

Unconventional:
Unlike typical toys, each piece of tiles can be replaced and more tiles can always be added to build objects as big as desired. 

Dream Big and Build Big!
No limitations, scalable to build as big as desired by adding more pieces and various shapes. PicassoTiles in colossol styles. Encourage creativity which is the key factor to success in today's ever changing environments. 

In The Box
-4 x large squares (6" x 6")
-24 x small squares (3" x 3")
-18 x small triangles (3" x 3")
-8 x medium (right) triangles (3" x 4")
-6 x tall triangles (3" x 5.5")
feature_bullets: DREAM BIG & BUILD BIG - No limitations, scalable to build as big as desired by adding more pieces to create the master piece. PicassoTiles in colossal styles.

LEARNING BY PLAYING - Never too early to start developing kids creativity. Children can acquire strong sense of color, geometrical shapes including 3D forms numbers counts, magnetic polarities & architectural design at early age.

BONDING BY PLAYING - Entertaining for single or multiple parties and feel the sense of achievement together. Suitable for all ages (3+ and up) by one party of in groups a great way to spend quality time with the family and love ones.

LEARNING IS FUN - Encourage creativity which is the key factor to success in today's ever-changing environments. Fun and entertaining, perfect educational presents for school age children that will never go out of style.
CREATIVITY BEYOND IMAGINATION - Magnet Building Tiles Clear 3D color Magnetic Building Blocks Playboards for preschool, pretend play and more. Easy to construct and easy to put away for storage.
